Serverless Computing

Summary

Cloud computing execution model that treats computing resources as a utility to be paid based on usage, like water or electricity.

Jots

aka FaaS or "Function as a Service‚Äù

A serverless application does its thing and stores its results elsewhere, such as DynamoDB. Once its task is complete, the execution resources are returned to the platform.

This should reduce cognitive load by requiring no persistent resources for execution. But because it exists in such an isolated context, you need to keep other things in mind, like persistence and execution warmup time.

#quote from Wikipedia:

Serverless functions can be used for:

Data analytics

CI/CD operations

File conversions

Log aggregation and restructuring

Support for dynamic website content

Services

AWS Lambda

Tools

Tooling for serverless covers everything from utility libraries to full-on frameworks

Serverless Framework

AWS Lambda Powertools
